member.name: M:GrafanaAdapters.AnnotationExtensions.TagFromKey(GSF.TimeSeries.MeasurementKey,System.Data.DataSet)
member.summary: Looks up point tag from measurement value.
member.returns: Point tag name from source metadata.
member.remarks: This function uses the function which uses a linear search algorithm that can be slow for large data sets, it is recommended that any results for calls to this function be cached to improve performance.

member.name: M:GrafanaAdapters.AnnotationExtensions.KeyFromTag(System.String,System.Data.DataSet,System.String)
member.summary: Looks up measurement key from point tag.
member.returns: Measurement key from source metadata.
member.remarks: This function uses the function which uses a linear search algorithm that can be slow for large data sets, it is recommended that any results for calls to this function be cached to improve performance.

member.name: M:GrafanaAdapters.AnnotationExtensions.KeyAndTagFromSignalID(System.String,System.Data.DataSet,System.String)
member.summary: Looks up measurement key from signal ID.
member.returns: Measurement key from source metadata.
member.remarks: This function uses the function which uses a linear search algorithm that can be slow for large data sets, it is recommended that any results for calls to this function be cached to improve performance.

member.name: M:GrafanaAdapters.AnnotationExtensions.SplitAlias(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Splits any defined alias from a point tag expression.
member.param: Source point tag expression that can contain an alias.
member.returns: Point tag name without any alias.

member.name: M:GrafanaAdapters.AnnotationExtensions.MetadataRecordFromTag(System.String,System.Data.DataSet,System.String)
member.summary: Looks up metadata record from point tag.
member.returns: Metadata record from source metadata for provided point tag.

remarks.para: Use "table.pointTag" format to specify which table to pull point tag from.

This function uses the function which uses a linear search algorithm that can be slow for large data sets, it is recommended that any results for calls to this function be cached to improve performance.

member.name: M:GrafanaAdapters.AnnotationExtensions.MetadataRecordFromSignalID(System.String,System.Data.DataSet,System.String)
member.summary: Looks up metadata record from signal ID.
member.returns: Metadata record from source metadata for provided point tag.
member.remarks: This function uses the function which uses a linear search algorithm that can be slow for large data sets, it is recommended that any results for calls to this function be cached to improve performance.

member.summary: Defines the default value for the .

member.summary: Defines the default value for the .

member.summary: Defines the default value for the .

member.summary: Defines the default value for the .

member.name: M:GrafanaAdapters.DeviceAlarmStateAdapter.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new .

member.name: P:GrafanaAdapters.DeviceAlarmStateAdapter.MonitoringRate
member.summary: Gets or sets monitoring rate, in milliseconds, for devices.

member.name: P:GrafanaAdapters.DeviceAlarmStateAdapter.AlarmMinutes
member.summary: Gets or sets the time, in minutes, for which to change the device state to alarm when no data is received.

member.name: P:GrafanaAdapters.DeviceAlarmStateAdapter.TargetParentDevices
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag that determines if alarm states should only target parent devices, i.e., PDCs and direct connect PMUs, or all devices.

member.name: P:GrafanaAdapters.DeviceAlarmStateAdapter.AcknowledgedTransitionHysteresisDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets delay time, in minutes, before transitioning the Acknowledged state back to Good.

member.name: P:GrafanaAdapters.DeviceAlarmStateAdapter.ExternalDatabaseHysteresisDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay time, in minutes, before reporting the external database state.

member.name: P:GrafanaAdapters.DeviceAlarmStateAdapter.ExternalDatabaseHysteresisMinimumState
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum state for application of . Defaults to setting Good and Alarm states immediately and applying delay to all other states.

member.name: P:GrafanaAdapters.DeviceAlarmStateAdapter.EnableExternalDatabaseSynchronization
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag that determines if an external database connection should be enabled for synchronization of alarm states.

member.name: P:GrafanaAdapters.DeviceAlarmStateAdapter.ExternalDatabaseConnnectionString
member.summary: Gets or sets the external database connection string used for synchronization of alarm states. Leave blank to use local configuration database defined in "systemSettings".

member.name: P:GrafanaAdapters.DeviceAlarmStateAdapter.ExternalDatabaseProviderString
member.summary: Gets or sets the external database provider string used for synchronization of alarm states.

member.name: P:GrafanaAdapters.DeviceAlarmStateAdapter.ExternalDatabaseCommand
member.summary: Gets or sets the external database command used for synchronization of alarm states.

member.name: P:GrafanaAdapters.DeviceAlarmStateAdapter.ExternalDatabaseCommandParameters
member.summary: Gets or sets the external database command parameters with value substitutions used for synchronization of alarm states.
member.remarks:
Examples for composite state reporting:
'openPDC Overall Device Status = {AlarmState}[?{AlarmState}!=Good[ -- for \[{Device.Acronym}\]]]'
'Good = {GoodStateCount} / Alarmed = {AlarmStateCount} / Unavailable = {NotAvailableStateCount} / Bad Data = {BadDataStateCount} / Bad Time = {BadTimeStateCount} / Out of Service = {OutOfServiceStateCount}[?{AlarmState}!=Good[ -- \<a href=\"http://localhost:8280/DeviceStatus.cshtml?DeviceID={Device.ID}\"\>\[{Device.Acronym}\] Device Status\</a\>]]'

member.name: P:GrafanaAdapters.DeviceAlarmStateAdapter.ExternalDatabaseMappedAlarmStates
member.summary: Gets or sets the external database mapped alarm states defining the {MappedAlarmState} command parameter substitution parameter used for synchronization of alarm states.

member.name: P:GrafanaAdapters.DeviceAlarmStateAdapter.ExternalDatabaseReportSingleCompositeState
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag that determines if external database should report a single composite state or a state for each device.

member.name: P:GrafanaAdapters.DeviceAlarmStateAdapter.InputMeasurementKeys
member.summary: Gets or sets primary keys of input measurements the adapter expects, if any.

member.name: P:GrafanaAdapters.DeviceAlarmStateAdapter.OutputMeasurements
member.summary: Gets or sets output measurements that the adapter will produce, if any.

member.name: P:GrafanaAdapters.DeviceAlarmStateAdapter.SupportsTemporalProcessing
member.summary: Gets the flag indicating if this adapter supports temporal processing.

member.name: P:GrafanaAdapters.DeviceAlarmStateAdapter.Status
member.summary: Returns the detailed status of the data input source.

member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the object and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: T:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction
member.summary: Defines available functions that can operate on .

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Average
member.summary: Returns a single value that represents the mean of the values in the source series.
member.remarks:
Signature: Average(expression)
Returns: Single value.
Example: Average(FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='FREQ')
Variants: Average, Avg, Mean
Execution: Immediate enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Minimum
member.summary: Returns a single value that is the minimum of the values in the source series.
member.remarks:
Signature: Minimum(expression)
Returns: Single value.
Example: Minimum(FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='FREQ')
Variants: Minimum, Min
Execution: Immediate enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Maximum
member.summary: Returns a single value that is the maximum of the values in the source series.
member.remarks:
Signature: Maximum(expression)
Returns: Single value.
Example: Maximum(FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='FREQ')
Variants: Maximum, Max
Execution: Immediate enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Total
member.summary: Returns a single value that represents the sum of the values in the source series.
member.remarks:
Signature: Total(expression)
Returns: Single value.
Example: Total(FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='IPHM')
Variants: Total, Sum
Execution: Immediate enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Range
member.summary: Returns a single value that represents the range, i.e., maximum - minimum, of the values in the source series.
member.remarks:
Signature: Range(expression)
Returns: Single value.
Example: Range(FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='FREQ')
Variants: Range
Execution: Immediate enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Count
member.summary: Returns a single value that is the count of the values in the source series.
member.remarks:
Signature: Count(expression)
Returns: Single value.
Example: Count(PPA:1; PPA:2; PPA:3)
Variants: Count
Execution: Immediate enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Distinct
member.summary: Returns a series of values that represent the unique set of values in the source series.
member.remarks:
Signature: Distinct(expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: Distinct(FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='FREQ')
Variants: Distinct, Unique
Execution: Deferred enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.AbsoluteValue
member.summary: Returns a series of values that represent the absolute value each of the values in the source series.
member.remarks:
Signature: AbsoluteValue(expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: AbsoluteValue(FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='CALC')
Variants: AbsoluteValue, Abs
Execution: Deferred enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Add
member.summary: Returns a series of values that represent each of the values in the source series added with N. N is a floating point value representing an additive offset to be applied to each value the source series. N can either be constant value or a named target available from the expression.
member.remarks:
Signature: Add(N, expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: Add(1.5, FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='CALC')
Variants: Add
Execution: Deferred enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Subtract
member.summary: Returns a series of values that represent each of the values in the source series subtracted by N. N is a floating point value representing an subtractive offset to be applied to each value the source series. N can either be constant value or a named target available from the expression.
member.remarks:
Signature: Subtract(N, expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: Subtract(2.2, FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='CALC')
Variants: Subtract

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Multiply
member.summary: Returns a series of values that represent each of the values in the source series multiplied by N. N is a floating point value representing a multiplicative factor to be applied to each value the source series. N can either be constant value or a named target available from the expression.
member.remarks:
Signature: Multiply(N, expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: Multiply(1.5, FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='CALC')
Variants: Multiply
Execution: Deferred enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Divide

Returns: Series of values.
Example: Divide(1.732, FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='CALC')

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Modulo
member.summary: Returns a series of values that represent each of the values in the source series modulo by N. N is a floating point value representing a divisive factor to be applied to each value the source series. N can either be constant value or a named target available from the expression.
member.remarks:
Signature: Modulo(N, expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: Mod(2, FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='CALC')
Variants: Modulo, Modulus, Mod
Execution: Deferred enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Round
member.summary: Returns a series of values that represent the rounded value, with N fractional digits, of each of the values in the source series. N, optional, is a positive integer value representing the number of decimal places in the return value - defaults to 0.
member.remarks:
Signature: Round([N = 0], expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: Round(3, FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='FREQ')
Variants: Round
Execution: Deferred enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Floor
member.summary: Returns a series of values that represent the smallest integral value that is less than or equal to each of the values in the source series.
member.remarks:
Signature: Floor(expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: Floor(FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='IPHM')
Variants: Floor
Execution: Deferred enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Ceiling
member.summary: Returns a series of values that represent the smallest integral value that is greater than or equal to each of the values in the source series.
member.remarks:
Signature: Ceiling(expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: Ceiling(FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='IPHM')
Variants: Ceiling, Ceil
Execution: Deferred enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Truncate
member.summary: Returns a series of values that represent the integral part of each of the values in the source series.
member.remarks:
Signature: Truncate(expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: Truncate(FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='IPHM')
Variants: Truncate, Trunc
Execution: Deferred enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.StandardDeviation
member.summary: Returns a single value that represents the standard deviation of the values in the source series. First parameter, optional, is a boolean flag representing if the sample based calculation should be used - defaults to false, which means the population based calculation should be used.
member.remarks:
Signature: StandardDeviation([useSampleCalc = false], expression)
Returns: Single value.
Example: StandardDeviation(FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='VPHM')
Variants: StandardDeviation, StdDev
Execution: Immediate in-memory array load.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Median
member.summary: Returns a single value that represents the median of the values in the source series.
member.remarks:
Signature: Median(expression)
Returns: Single value.
Example: Median(FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='ALOG')
Variants: Median, Med, Mid
Execution: Immediate in-memory array load.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Mode
member.summary: Returns a single value that represents the mode of the values in the source series.
member.remarks:
Signature: Mode(expression)
Returns: Single value.
Example: Mode(FILTER TOP 5 ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='DIGI')
Variants: Mode
Execution: Immediate in-memory array load.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Top
member.summary: Returns a series of N, or N% of total, values that are the largest in the source series. N is either a positive integer value, representing a total, that is greater than zero - or - a floating point value, suffixed with '%' representing a percentage, that must range from greater than 0 to less than or equal to 100. Second parameter, optional, is a boolean flag representing if time in dataset should be normalized - defaults to true. N can either be constant value or a named target available from the expression. Any target values that fall between 0 and 1 will be treated as a percentage.
member.remarks:
Signature: Top(N|N%, [normalizeTime = true], expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: Top(50%, FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='FREQ')
Variants: Top, Largest
Execution: Immediate in-memory array load.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Bottom
member.summary: Returns a series of N, or N% of total, values that are the smallest in the source series. N is either a positive integer value, representing a total, that is greater than zero - or - a floating point value, suffixed with '%' representing a percentage, that must range from greater than 0 to less than or equal to 100. Second parameter, optional, is a boolean flag representing if time in dataset should be normalized - defaults to true. N can either be constant value or a named target available from the expression. Any target values that fall between 0 and 1 will be treated as a percentage.
member.remarks:
Signature: Bottom(N|N%, [normalizeTime = true], expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: Bottom(100, false, FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='FREQ')
Variants: Bottom, Bot, Smallest
Execution: Immediate in-memory array load.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Random
member.summary: Returns a series of N, or N% of total, values that are a random sample of the values in the source series. N is either a positive integer value, representing a total, that is greater than zero - or - a floating point value, suffixed with '%' representing a percentage, that must range from greater than 0 to less than or equal to 100. Second parameter, optional, is a boolean flag representing if time in dataset should be normalized - defaults to true. N can either be constant value or a named target available from the expression. Any target values that fall between 0 and 1 will be treated as a percentage.
member.remarks:
Signature: Random(N|N%, [normalizeTime = true], expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: Random(25%, FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='VPHM')
Variants: Random, Rand, Sample
Execution: Immediate in-memory array load.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.First
member.summary: Returns a series of N, or N% of total, values from the start of the source series. N, optional, is either a positive integer value, representing a total, that is greater than zero - or - a floating point value, suffixed with '%' representing a percentage, that must range from greater than 0 to less than or equal to 100 - defaults to 1. N can either be constant value or a named target available from the expression. Any target values that fall between 0 and 1 will be treated as a percentage.
member.remarks:
Signature: First([N|N% = 1], expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: First(5%, FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='FREQ')
Variants: First
Execution: Immediate in-memory array load.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Last
member.summary: Returns a series of N, or N% of total, values from the end of the source series. N, optional, is either a positive integer value, representing a total, that is greater than zero - or - a floating point value, suffixed with '%' representing a percentage, that must range from greater than 0 to less than or equal to 100 - defaults to 1. N can either be constant value or a named target available from the expression. Any target values that fall between 0 and 1 will be treated as a percentage.
member.remarks:
Signature: Last([N|N% = 1], expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: Last(150, FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='FREQ')
Variants: Last
Execution: Immediate in-memory array load.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Percentile
member.summary: Returns a single value that represents the Nth order percentile for the sorted values in the source series. N is a floating point value, representing a percentage, that must range from 0 to 100.
member.remarks:
Signature: Percentile(N[%], expression)
Returns: Single value.
Example: Percentile(10%, FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='VPHM')
Variants: Percentile, Pctl
Execution: Immediate in-memory array load.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Difference
member.summary: Returns a series of values that represent the difference between consecutive values in the source series.
member.remarks:
Signature: Difference(expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: Difference(FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='FREQ')
Variants: Difference, Diff
Execution: Deferred enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.TimeDifference
member.summary: Returns a series of values that represent the time difference, in time units, between consecutive values in the source series. The units parameter, optional, specifies the type of time units and must be one of the following: Seconds, Nanoseconds, Microseconds, Milliseconds, Minutes, Hours, Days, Weeks, Ke (i.e., traditional Chinese unit of decimal time), Ticks (i.e., 100-nanosecond intervals), PlanckTime or AtomicUnitsOfTime - defaults to Seconds.
member.remarks:
Signature: TimeDifference([units = Seconds], expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: TimeDifference(FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='FREQ')
Variants: TimeDifference, TimeDiff, Elapsed
Execution: Deferred enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Derivative
member.summary: Returns a series of values that represent the rate of change, per time units, for the difference between consecutive values in the source series. The units parameter, optional, specifies the type of time units and must be one of the following: Seconds, Nanoseconds, Microseconds, Milliseconds, Minutes, Hours, Days, Weeks, Ke (i.e., traditional Chinese unit of decimal time), Ticks (i.e., 100-nanosecond intervals), PlanckTime or AtomicUnitsOfTime - defaults to Seconds.
member.remarks:
Signature: Derivative([units = Seconds], expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: Derivative(FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='FREQ')
Variants: Derivative, Der
Execution: Deferred enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.TimeIntegration
member.summary: Returns a single value that represents the time-based integration, i.e., the sum of V(n) * (T(n) - T(n-1)) where time difference is calculated in the specified time units, of the values in the source series. The units parameter, optional, specifies the type of time units and must be one of the following: Seconds, Nanoseconds, Microseconds, Milliseconds, Minutes, Hours, Days, Weeks, Ke (i.e., traditional Chinese unit of decimal time), Ticks (i.e., 100-nanosecond intervals), PlanckTime or AtomicUnitsOfTime - defaults to Hours.
member.remarks:
Signature: TimeIntegration([units = Hours], expression)
Returns: Single value.
Example: TimeIntegration(FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='CALC' AND PointTag LIKE '%-MW:%')
Variants: TimeIntegration, TimeInt
Execution: Immediate enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Interval
member.summary: Returns a series of values that represent a decimated set of the values in the source series based on the specified interval N, in time units. N is a floating-point value that must be greater than or equal to zero that represents the desired time interval, in time units, for the returned data. The units parameter, optional, specifies the type of time units and must be one of the following: Seconds, Nanoseconds, Microseconds, Milliseconds, Minutes, Hours, Days, Weeks, Ke (i.e., traditional Chinese unit of decimal time), Ticks (i.e., 100-nanosecond intervals), PlanckTime or AtomicUnitsOfTime - defaults to Seconds. Setting N value to zero will request non-decimated, full resolution data from the data source. A zero N value will always produce the most accurate aggregation calculation results but will increase query burden for large time ranges. N can either be constant value or a named target available from the expression.
member.remarks:
Signature: Interval(N, [units = Seconds], expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: Sum(Interval(0, FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType LIKE '%PHM'))
Variants: Interval
Execution: Deferred enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.IncludeRange
member.summary: Returns a series of values that represent a filtered set of the values in the source series where each value falls between the specified low and high. The low and high parameter values are floating-point numbers that represent the range of values allowed in the return series. Third parameter, optional, is a boolean flag that determines if range values are inclusive, i.e., allowed values are >= low and <= high - defaults to false, which means values are exclusive, i.e., allowed values are > low and < high. Function allows a fourth optional parameter that is a boolean flag - when four parameters are provided, third parameter determines if low value is inclusive and forth parameter determines if high value is inclusive. The low and high parameter values can either be constant values or named targets available from the expression.
member.remarks:
Signature: IncludeRange(low, high, [inclusive = false], expression) -or- IncludeRange(low, high, [lowInclusive = false], [highInclusive = false], expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: IncludeRange(59.90, 60.10, FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='FREQ')
Variants: IncludeRange, Include
Execution: Deferred enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.ExcludeRange
member.summary: Returns a series of values that represent a filtered set of the values in the source series where each value falls outside the specified low and high. The low and high parameter values are floating-point numbers that represent the range of values excluded in the return series. Third parameter, optional, is a boolean flag that determines if range values are inclusive, i.e., excluded values are <= low or >= high - defaults to false, which means values are exclusive, i.e., excluded values are < low or > high. Function allows a fourth optional parameter that is a boolean flag - when four parameters are provided, third parameter determines if low value is inclusive and forth parameter determines if high value is inclusive. The low and high parameter values can either be constant values or named targets available from the expression.
member.remarks:
Signature: ExcludeRange(low, high, [inclusive = false], expression) -or- ExcludeRange(low, high, [lowInclusive = false], [highInclusive = false], expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: ExcludeRange(-180.0, 180.0, true, false, FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType LIKE '%PHA')
Variants: ExcludeRange, Exclude
Execution: Deferred enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.FilterNaN
member.summary: Returns a series of values that represent a filtered set of the values in the source series where each value is a real number, i.e., value is not NaN. First parameter, optional, is a boolean flag that determines if infinite values should also be excluded - defaults to true.
member.remarks:
Signature: FilterNaN([alsoFilterInfinity = true], expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: FilterNaN(FILTER ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='VPHM')
Variants: FilterNaN
Execution: Deferred enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.UnwrapAngle
member.summary: Returns a series of values that represent an adjusted set of angles that are unwrapped, per specified angle units, so that a comparable mathematical operation can be executed. For example, for angles that wrap between -180 and +180 degrees, this algorithm unwraps the values to make the values mathematically comparable. The units parameter, optional, specifies the type of angle units and must be one of the following: Degrees, Radians, Grads, ArcMinutes, ArcSeconds or AngularMil - defaults to Degrees.
member.remarks:
Signature: UnwrapAngle([units = Degrees], expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: UnwrapAngle(FSX_PMU2-PA1:VH; REA_PMU3-PA2:VH)
Variants: UnwrapAngle, Unwrap
Execution: Immediate in-memory array load.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.WrapAngle
member.summary: Returns a series of values that represent an adjusted set of angles that are wrapped, per specified angle units, so that angle values are consistently between -180 and +180 degrees. The units parameter, optional, specifies the type of angle units and must be one of the following: Degrees, Radians, Grads, ArcMinutes, ArcSeconds or AngularMil - defaults to Degrees.
member.remarks:
Signature: WrapAngle([units = Degrees], expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: WrapAngle(Radians, FILTER TOP 5 ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType LIKE '%PHA')
Variants: WrapAngle, Wrap
Execution: Deferred enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Label
member.summary: Renames a series with the specified label value. If multiple series are targeted, labels will be indexed starting at one, e.g., if there are three series in the target expression with a label value of "Max", series would be labeled as "Max 1", "Max 2" and "Max 3". Group operations on this function will be ignored. The label parameter also supports substitutions when root target metadata can be resolved. For series values that directly map to a point tag, metadata value substitutions for the tag can be used in the label value - for example: {ID}, {SignalID}, {PointTag}, {AlternateTag}, {SignalReference}, {Device}, {FramesPerSecond}, {Protocol}, {ProtocolType}, {SignalType}, {EngineeringUnits}, {PhasorType}, {Company}, {Description} - where applicable, these substitutions can be used in any combination.
member.remarks:
Signature: Label(value, expression)
Returns: Series of values.
Example: Label('AvgFreq', SetAvg(FILTER TOP 20 ActiveMeasurements WHERE SignalType='FREQ'))
Variants: Label, Name
Execution: Deferred enumeration.

member.name: F:GrafanaAdapters.SeriesFunction.Evaluate
member.summary: Evaluates an expression over a slice of values in one or more series. The `evalExpression` parameter must always be expressed in braces, e.g., `{ expression }`; expressions are strongly typed, but not case sensitive. Expressions are expected to return a value that can be evaluated as a floating-point number. Target tag names are used as variables in the expression. The Evaluate function is always evaluated as a slice, any specified group operation prefix will be ignored. Default .NET system types available to expressions are and . Use the "Imports" command to define more types for expressions.
member.remarks:
Signature: Evaluate(sliceTolerance, evalExpression, filterExpression)
Returns: Single value per slice.
Example: eval(0.0333, {R * Sin(T * PI / 180)}, T=GPA_SHELBY-PA1:VH; R=GPA_SHELBY-PM1:V)
Variants: Evaluate, Eval
Execution: Deferred enumeration.

member.summary: Operates on each series as a group per time-slice.

member.summary: Performs no group operation on the series set.
